summary: The WIC Collaboration Study Act directs the Comptroller General of the United States to study interagency data sharing and collaboration between state agencies administering WIC, SNAP, and Medicaid. The study aims to determine if such collaboration could increase WIC enrollment. It will examine data sharing practices, certification process simplification, overlap in required information, the effectiveness of agency meetings, the role of nonprofits in WIC certification, and the potential costs of mandatory data sharing.
